UFC.creator: Jeff Cain
UFC.title: Ian Machado Garry 'livid' about not getting UFC 315 title fight
UFC.content:encoded:
On May 10, at Bell Centre in Montreal, Quebec, Canada, Jack Della Maddalena will fight champion Belal Muhammad for the welterweight title and Ian Machado Garry is not happy about it.

Muhammad (24-3) was scheduled to put his title on the line for the first time against the undefeated Shavkat Rakhmonov (19-0) but a knee injury prevented Rakhmonov from competing. Matchmakers opted to pit Muhammad against Della Maddalena (17-2) instead.

In a video posted to Instagram, Garry (15-1) said he was 'livid' with the fight promotion's decision to grant Della Maddalena a title shot and that he would have been a better option. 

“Why aren’t I fighting for the title? I had a chat with my agent. I rang him when he told me about this news, and I was livid – still am to this day," Garry said in the video. 

"I had a No. 1 contender’s fight where the guy. (Rakhmonov) now has to get knee reconstruction and is out for a year. But you know, it’s not my fault. I didn’t do it. I didn’t stab his knee 20 something times and boot the leg off. I’m not fighting for a world title because I’m coming off a loss, and they’re giving it to a guy who’s been injured for a year, and they think that’s more exciting, but they’re wrong.

“The world title fight was meant to be Shavkat Rakhmonov taking on Belal Muhammad, but Shavkat apparently is out injured. I wonder how that happened? Now they’re pulling in a guy who hasn’t fought in a year because he’s had an operation on his forearm because he broke it in his last fight, hasn’t fought in a long time, and hasn’t been active. So, they’ve given it to Jack Della Maddalena because I’m coming off of a loss. That’s Okay. Don’t worry. I’ll get you all. You’re all mine.”

View the original article to see embedded media.

Currently unbooked for a fight, Garry would like to be back in action during International Fight Week in June. 

"When am I fighting again? I would like to fight International Fight Week, June 28," Garry said. "I don't care who. I don't care who they want to put in front of me. I just want to fight and I want to prove that I'm the best in the world."  

Garry suffered his first career loss in his last outing, losing to Rakhmomov via decision. He's ranked No. 7 in the welterweight division. Della Maddalena is riding a 17-fight winning streak and hasn't tasted defeat in nine years. He's ranked fourth in the 170-pound weight class.

UFC.title: Leon Edwards and Sean Brady face-off outside The O2 Arena in London
UFC.content:encoded:
This weekend's main event fighters, former welterweight champion Leon Edwards and No. 5 ranked contender Sean Brady, faced off outside The O2 Arena in London on Tuesday.

Edwards (22-4, 1 NC) lost the welterweight title to Belal Muhammad last July. It was the first loss for "Rocky" in a decade. On Saturday, he'll be looking to rebound from the loss and put himself in line for another title shot. 

Brady (17-1) is riding a two-fight winning streak with his only career loss coming to champion Muhammad. A win over Edwards could result in a title shot in his next outing. 

Check out the two going face-to-face outside the venue they'll be fighting in on Saturday.

👀 Up Close! First face-off between our #UFCLondon main event! 🇬🇧

Edwards vs Brady | SATURDAY | LIVE @UFCFIghtPass pic.twitter.com/f1IpuyXwgx

— UFC Canada (@UFC_CA) March 18, 2025

UFC.creator: Jeff Cain
UFC.title: Leon Edwards expects a title shot with UFC London win
UFC.content:encoded:
Former welterweight champion Leon Edwards headlines this weekend's UFC event at The O2 Arena in London against No. 5 ranked Sean Brady. Edwards lost the 170-pound championship to Belal Muhammad last July and looks to round with a win on Saturday. 

The loss to Muhammad doesn't sit well with Edwards, but he's put that past him. Now he wants to remind everyone 

"It is what it is. No excuses. Like I said, on my worst day he won one round over me to get a decision. That's it. I'm no longer focused on that fight. I'll get it back for sure," Edwards said during an appearance on The Ariel Helwani Show. 

Edwards was originally slated to face Jack Della Maddalena but Maddalena was pulled from the fight to face the champion when Muhammad's opponent, Shavkat Rakhmonov, was forced out of the upcoming UFC 315 title fight due to injury. Now facing Brady, Edwards is used to what Brady brings to the table. 

"He's a style I'm used to. It's what I've been fighting now for many years. He's a short, boxing, wrestling kind of guy. It's something I'm used to and I feel like it gives me a chance to go out there and prove to the world that I am who I am and I'll go out there and prove it to the world. I am the best welterweight of all time and he's just another guy in my way."

Related: Dana White receives option to solve Jon Jones vs. Tom Aspinall dilemma

Edwards is the top contender in the welterweight division and expects to get a title shot with a win over Brady on Saturday.

"I feel like, for me, it's a No. 1 contender fight. I go out there and I perform like I know I will perform, I feel like the title shot is next. That's the only fight that makes sense for me," Edwards said.

UFC.title: Conor McGregor meets Donald Trump at the White House
UFC.content:encoded:
After accepting his invite to the White House, Conor McGregor was nothing but complimentary toward Donald Trump as the two came face to face.

Millions of people have countless things to say both good and bad about 'The Notorious', but one thing that cannot be denied is the love that the man has for his country. The UFC icon has been vocal about problems plaguing Ireland at present and believes he has some answers to fix the ongoing situation.

During his trip to the White House, Conor McGregor spoke to the media about his concerns for his declining nation, but that wasn't the only thing he did while attending the US President's residence.

McGregor was able to meet Donald Trump and showed nothing but love and respect for the 78-year-old.

Conor McGregor offered Donald Trump a custom-made suit from his August McGregor collection before offering his congratulations.

"Nice pinstripe suit, it's one of my own," McGregor said in response to Trump's compliment about his attire. "I can get you one if you want."

"Congratulations. I'll tell you what, your work ethic is inspiring. Your work rate is inspiring."

Related: Conor McGregor crashes the White House briefing room 'travesty'

Conor McGregor was accompanied by his wife Dee Devlin and their four kids, who all received a warm welcome to Donald Trump's office.

Conor McGregor meets with President Trump in the Oval Office! 🇮🇪🍀🇺🇸 pic.twitter.com/xJB8ZauXAZ

— The White House (@WhiteHouse) March 17, 2025

This meeting comes just days after Donald Trump praised Conor McGregor during his sit-down with Ireland's Prime Minister Michael Martin.

Trump claimed to like McGregor and later complimented the UFC star's tattoos.

Conor McGregor was also in attendance at the Starlight Ball earlier this year. The 36-year-old rubbed shoulders with the stars as many turned up to celebrate Donald Trump's inauguration.

Among those attending the ball was Elon Musk who is one of the president's most notable supporters. Musk was also pictured alongside McGregor at the White House on Monday.

President Trump, Elon Musk and Conor McGregor pictured together in the Oval Office today, on St. Patrick’s Day.

What an endorsement for Conor McGregor’s Presidential bid in Ireland! 🇺🇸🇮🇪 pic.twitter.com/0ItfOoxH2O

— Cillian (@CilComLFC) March 17, 2025

UFC.title: UFC's Netflix/ESPN dilemma gets major update
UFC.content:encoded:
The UFC's TV rights deal dilemma is beginning to heat up, and it's not just Netflix and ESPN that are interested in doing business with the MMA promotion.

UFC has reportedly found themselves in a precarious situation with their current broadcast partner and could be planning to jump ship in a potential multi-billion dollar deal. Since announcing their interest in live sporting events, rumors have swirled linking the Ultimate Fighting Championship to Netflix, though the situation seems much more complicated than first thought.

According to UFC veteran Brendan Schaub, his inside scoop has informed him that the news being reported about UFC and ESPN's fallout is false. Schaub gave his idea of what the sport will look like going forward.

"None of [the ongoing reports are] true," Schaub said. "I have a very good inside source."

"I said the UFC, they're going to do what the NFL does where some of it's on Amazon, Monday Night Football's on a different network. Thursday Night Football, Sunday Football, they're kind of on a bunch of different networks."

Schaub then revealed what his source told him about the situation.

"That connected source from the New York Post isn't accurate in any facet," Schaub relayed from his source. "Netflix isn't even the highest bidder at the moment."

"Don't be shocked if the pay-per-views and four big fight nights stay with ESPN and the Apex fights go to Netflix and/or Amazon."

"If the UFC wants that mainstream 24/7 coverage, they stick with ESPN and the pay-per-views make sense there. The Apex shows will be on Netflix like WWE Raw."

Related: UFC's relationship with ESPN on the verge of collapse

Schaub later weighed in with his thoughts.

"Don't get it twisted, the UFC is a proven pay-per-view success. They have a business model, they would never ever give that up and sign all their media rights deals to Netflix."

Listen to Brendan Schaub's comments on the UFC's Netflix/ESPN/Amazon dilemma below.

UFC.title: Conor McGregor crashes the White House briefing room 'travesty'
UFC.content:encoded:
Conor McGregor has forever been passionate about his nationality and is a proud representative of the Irish flag. So, when he was given the chance to raise his concerns about the state of his country at the White House, he did so with open arms.

'The Notorious' is vocal about his views on Ireland and where he believes the country should be heading to better those who reside there. The UFC star has hinted at running for prime minister later this year and Elon Musk has even endorsed the potential political campaign.

Ireland is known for many things but Conor McGregor believes the country is losing its beauty. McGregor shared his concerns to the media in the White House.

"I'm here to raise the issues the people of Ireland face," McGregor said. "It'll be music to the people of Ireland's ears because never on the main stage has the issues the people of Ireland face been [spoken]."

"Our government has long since abandoned the voices of the people of Ireland, and it's high time that America is made aware of what is going on in Ireland."

"What is going on in Ireland is a travesty! Our government is the government of zero action with zero accountability. You know, our money is being spent on overseas issues that has nothing to do with the Irish people."

Related: Donald Trump voices honest opinion of Conor McGregor

Conor McGregor's main fear is illegal immigration in his country. Ireland has seen a large spike in crimes being committed by non-Irish citizens in recent years and McGregor wants the issues resolved.

"The illegal immigration racket is running ravaged on the country. There are rural towns in Ireland that have been overrun in one swoop, that have become a minority in one swoop."

"The 40,000,000 Irish Americans, as I said, need to hear this because if not, there will be no place to come home and visit."

McGregor bravely took the chance to voice his issues to millions of Americans. Check it out below.

🚨 WOW! Irishman Conor McGregor in the WH press briefing room laid out the dire situation in his home country, Ireland. He is very passionate and is set to meet with Trump.

McGregor says the Irish government is not focused on Irish people and illegal immigration is running… pic.twitter.com/0eoy9oke9Z

— Eric Daugherty (@EricLDaugh) March 17, 2025

UFC.title: Logan Paul's boxing challenge to Lionel Messi
UFC.content:encoded:
Logan Paul is ready to step back into the boxing ring, but this time again soccer superstar Lionel Messi.

Even with the many people not rooting for him, the 29-year-old knows how to capture fans' attention and keep them engaged. While he may not take boxing as seriously as his brother Jake Paul does, 'The Maverick' is still experienced inside the squared circle; making his latest callout extremely bizarre.

Logan Paul is currently in an ongoing legal dispute with Lionel Messi over the similarities of their energy drinks. Prime Hydration is a worldwide entity beloved by many, and while MAS+ is itself rising to fame, the resemblance between the beverages is uncanny.

Logan Paul has offered to settle the Prime vs. Más beef if Lionel Messi agrees to step into the ring with him this year! 😳

(📹 @LoganPaul) pic.twitter.com/AMLU7kOQ0N

— DAZN Football (@DAZNFootball) February 17, 2025

Messi's brand launched two years after Prime, proving Paul's concerns are warranted. 

But now, instead of pursuing legal action, Logan Paul wants to settle his differences in the ring with Lionel Messi. While it's not the biggest height differential in combat sports history, Paul will stand seven inches taller than Messi should the pair lock horns in the ring.

Related: TKO planning mega event featuring UFC, WWE, and boxing all on one card

In what will come as a shock to nobody, the Inter Miami soccer player hasn't responded to the callout, but one man has. 

Lionel Messi's bodyguard, Yassine Chueko, welcomed the chance to fight Logan Paul, insisting he will step into the bout on Messi's behalf.

"Look, Leo doesn't know who this guy is," Chueko said in response to the callout. "So, if he really wants to fight, he can fight against me. Not against a soccer player."

Having served in Iraq and Afghanistan as a former United States Army veteran, Yassine Chueko was able to refine and hone his craft in hand-to-hand combat as a Navy Seal.

As seen in the video above, Chueko is well-versed in martial arts and could pose a real threat to Logan Paul's chances of winning.

Listen to Lionel Messi's bodyguard respond to Logan Paul below.

Lionel Messi’s bodyguard wants to fight Logan Paul for calling out Messi 👀 pic.twitter.com/0U99SbaDlA

— Happy Punch (@HappyPunch) March 15, 2025

UFC.title: 'King' Callum Walsh scores stunning first round knockout win
UFC.content:encoded:
Callum Walsh has been a sensation throughout his early career in boxing and added another sensational knockout to his record on Sunday night.

Early into his life in the ring, the 24-year-old has displayed some devastating power in his hands. Having debuted in 2021, the rising star has managed to finish 11 of his 13 opponents, leaving his knockout percentage at a staggering 85%—thanks to his win on March 16.

In a fight he was expected to win, Callum Walsh delivered. From the opening bell, Walsh was visibly levels above his opponent Dean Sutherland, and it didn't take long for him to find the finishing touch.

Walsh piled on the pressure with just seconds left on the clock, eventually forcing Sutherland to crack. Despite landing an arsenal of shots leading up to the finish, it was a short right hook that brought an end to the night deep into the first round.

Another statement win for the prospect sees him extend his record to a perfect 13-0.

During his meteoric rise to the limelight, nobody has taken a bigger interest in the Irishman than Dana White. The UFC CEO has taken Walsh under his wing and believes the young star is destined for the top.

The Cork native is slowly becoming a household name for combat sports fans and could soon see an astronomical change to his career.

The sport of boxing could be about to change forever, and Callum Walsh could be at the forefront of that.

Dana White and Turki Alalshikh have partnered to found TKO Boxing; a new boxing promotion which promises a change for the sweet science.

Any new organization would be in desperate need of stars, and one name White will undoubtedly be looking toward is the surging Callum Walsh.

UFC.title: Dana White receives option to solve Jon Jones vs. Tom Aspinall dilemma
UFC.content:encoded:
The Jon Jones vs. Tom Aspinall matchup is becoming somewhat of a circus, but Dana White may have now been handed a solution to solve it.

Rumors suggest the 'Bones' camp is hesitant to accept the heavyweight title unification bout despite the Brit being the clear number one contender. As the division sits in limbo, an idea has arisen which could solve all of the UFC's problems.

Rising contender Jailton Almeida believes his plan could answer all of the heavyweight division's questions. The South American insists that the best way to solve the stalemate at the top of the weight class is to hold a grand prix.

"Let's do it like this," Almeida said on social media. "Jones x Aspinall fight for the belt [and] a Grand Prix between the contenders."

"[Jailton] Almeida x [Alexander] Volkov, this fight was already booked and I'm the only one Volkov hasn't fought yet. [Ciryl] Gane x [Sergei Pavlovich], two European strikers who never fought each other."

But how does that solve the crisis at heavyweight? If Jones vs. Aspinall does take place, who will be given a shot at him between the four contenders mentioned above?

Well, according to Almeida, the man who comes away with the most memorable victory in their respective fight should be given a shot at UFC gold.

"Who wins most impressive [fights] for [the] belt."

Lets do it like this
Jones x Aspinall fight for belt + a GP between the contenders:
Almeida x Volkov this fight was already booked and Im the only one Volkov hasnt fought yet
Gane x Sergey two European strikers who never fought each other
Who wins most impressive fight for belt

— Jailton Almeida “Malhadinho” (@Malhadinho_UFC) March 14, 2025

Related: Dana White provides timeline for Jon Jones vs. Tom Aspinall fight

While Almeida's plan isn't perfect, it does cater to viewers as fans have been clamoring for the UFC to do a Grand Prix-style tournament for several years. 

The six-man showcase would undoubtedly bring some much-needed attention to the heavyweight division, but will it solve the Jon Jones vs. Tom Aspinall fight delay?

Throughout the doubt surrounding the blockbuster affair, Dana White has remained positive and believes the fight could get booked for summer.

UFC.title: Justin Gaethje 'ideal' next matchup for Islam Makhachev, says coach
UFC.content:encoded:
Islam Makhachev will defend his lightweight title against Justin Gaethje next, if his coach Javier Mendez has any say in the matter.

The Dagestani is hoping to continue his reign of terror in the lightweight division and has several options of who his next fight may be. One choice for the 155 lbs champion is the former featherweight king, Ilia Topuria; though he isn't the preferred opponent.

Legendary coach Javier Mendez has weighed in on who he believes is the perfect man to test themselves against Islam Makhachev's title dominance. 

"Fantastic, then it's Justin Gaethje," Mendez said in response to who's next. "We'll focus on Justin Gaethje."

"That would be ideal for us, the perfect matchup based on the fact where his standing is and what he's done. And he's a big known guy and Islam hasn't fought him so he's perfect."

Justin Gaethje got the honor of sharing the octagon with Khabib Nurmagomedov before the star's retirement, but coach Mendez believes a fight with Islam Makhachev would go much differently.

"It definitely in my opinion would play out differently because [Khabib and Islam] are not the same fighter. They're not the same fighter."

"Islam is more well-rounded than Khabib ever was. So, Islam is at the point where he's pound-for-pound number one because he's well-rounded in all the areas..."

"It's an entirely different fight. Islam, he can do it all. He can stand with him, he can take him down, he can do anything."

Related: Daniel Cormier dominates Khabib Nurmagomedov in leaked training footage

Mendez continued.

"Let's see what the UFC decides but I think that Dana [White] saying that [Gaethje is next], I'm with Dana on that."

"I think that it's something that definitely, I myself am excited about the probability of that. Or, I like Arman [Tsarukyan]."

Listen to coach Javier Mendez's comments about Islam Makhachev, Justin Gaethje, and more below.

UFC.title: UFC's relationship with ESPN on the verge of collapse
UFC.content:encoded:
Despite their deal reaching six years, the UFC and ESPN are both disappointed with their agreement, and the two powerhouses are on the verge of a split.

After partnering with ESPN in 2019, everything looked great for the UFC, which was now being broadcast by one of the biggest sports outlets in the world. Some of the biggest moments in MMA history have taken place during their collaboration, but it now looks like things have turned sour between the business juggernauts.

According to reports, both sides are dissatisfied with the recent state of affairs. Some concerns have been raised by the UFC with ESPN's coverage.

The promotion is upset with ESPN for the issues that occurred during UFC 313; a huge event for the company, as arguably their current biggest star was headlining the event.

Technical problems have been a big factor in the organization's disappointment.

On the other hand, ESPN isn't pleased with the UFC for their apparent lack of pay-per-view sales. The cable sports channel expected much more when originally signing the deal and believes the UFC isn't fulfilling their side of the agreement.

Reports suggest that PPV numbers are down and the infamous 'PPV points' model is slowly becoming worthless for fighters eligible for the incentive.

Related: The UFC is not the same without Conor McGregor's star power

The UFC's deal with ESPN is set to expire some time this year. With no plans on a renewal, the UFC are allegedly planning to push ahead in pursuit of a new broadcaster.

There have been strong links for the octagon's new home to be on Netflix, though much needs to be discussed before that can be the case.

Netflix has forced their way into the live sporting event world. The streaming service has already ventured into the NFL, WWE, boxing, and could potentially be adding the UFC to its ever-growing catalog.

EXCLUSIVE: TKO/UFC Brass is “absolutely furious” ESPN after streaming issues marred UFC 313

UFC can begin negotiating with Netflix, Amazon starting April 15.

That and much more on @nypostsports 👇https://t.co/oiH1ARVb8z

— Erich Richter (@erichterrr) March 10, 2025

UFC.title: Roman Dolidze avenges previous loss to Marvin Vettori at UFC Vegas 104
UFC.content:encoded:
A middleweight rematch between former title challenger Marvin Vettori and Roman Dolidze headlined Saturday's UFC Vegas 104 fight card at the UFC Apex in Las Vegas. 

Vettori had been out of action since June 2023 due to injury and planned to return to contender status in the 185-pound division. Dolidze made the walk to the octagon coming off back-to-back wins hoping to extend his winning streak. Despite the inactivity, Vettori entered the fight ranked No. 8 in the division while Dolidze occupied the No. 12 spot. 

Dolidze moved forward in the opening moments and the two exchanged leg kicks. Vettori moved on the outside continuing to land leg kicks. He moved into the pocket and Dolidze connected with a counter right hand. A clash of heads momentarily halted the fight before the action resumed.  

Dolidze pressed forward with a combination but Vettori covered and circled away. Vettori employed a higher output in the opening round. Vettori connected with a clean right hand as Dolidze moved into the pocket. Both fighters mostly threw power punches. MMAWeekly scored the round 10-9 for Vettori.

Vettori pressured Dolidze to start the second round. Dolidze accidentally poked Vettori in the eye. Referee Herb Dean gave Dolidze a strong warning. He spoke with Dolidze between rounds about his fingers being extended. 

When the fight resumed, Dolidze landed a right hook. Vettori continued to be committed to leg kicks. Dolidze was creative with spinning attacks and a variety of kicks. Vettori avoided them, however. Vettori connected with a combination late in the round. MMAWeekly scored the round 10-9 for Vettori but it was a close round. 

Dolidze opened the third round landing a right hand. Vettor landed a left hand that hurt Dolidze. He pressured the Georgian but Dolidze fired back. Vettori didn't press the situation. Vettori landed a left hand. Dolidze responded with a jab. He mixed in a couple of high kicks but Vettori blocked them. Dolidze picked up his output in the third and set the pace. He clinched late in the round and that's how the frame ended.  MMAWeekly scored the round 10-9 Dolidze.

Dolidze pressured Vettori in the fourth. He connected with a knee up the middle. He began walking Vettori down. Vettori planted his feet and delivered a stiff jab. Dolidze unleashed a combination causing Vettori to retreat. He connected with a back elbow. Vettori absorbed it. Vettori's pace slowed the final two rounds. They exchanged right hands. MMAWeekly scored the round 10-9 for Dolidze. 

Heading into the final frame, it was anyone's fight. Dolize's right hand found a home. The pace picked up. Vettori started throwing combinations. Dolidze reacted with a right hand. Dolidze went to the body with a kick. Vettori connected with a straight left. Dolidze accidentally had a kick go low. Vettori recovered and the fight resumed. A head kick partially landed for Dolidze followed by a knee. Dolidze really picked up the pace in the final minute. MMAWeekly scored the round 10-9 for Dolidze.

The judges scored the fight for Dolidze by unanimous decision. All three scorecards read 49-46.

UFC.title: UFC veteran provides huge update on Nick Diaz's wellbeing
UFC.content:encoded:
Over the past couple of years, fans have been concerned for Nick Diaz's wellbeing outside of the cage. 

The older Diaz brother has had an impressive career in the sport, managing to capture Strikeforce gold and being recognized as one of the biggest names in MMA during his heights. After dealing with suspension and various other issues, the now-41-year-old stumbled upon some problems in his personal life.

Many feared the worst, expecting Nick Diaz to go down an un-salvageable path, but that may not be the case.

Hoping to get back into the octagon, Diaz seems to be on the mend. According to UFC veteran Jason Miller, the fan-favorite is on the right path.

"Somebody [from Nick Diaz's camp] gave me a note," Miller said. "[The note said], 'Hey, look, he's getting it together.'"

Miller later weighed in on Diaz's struggles outside of competing, shedding light on the struggles that similar people face.

"It's very sensitive to talk about this guys journey because I have a lot of empathy for it."

"Because it's easy, like I said, to fall into this darkness. People do not understand how, you know, if you're a C-level celebrity, it's super easy."

Related: Nick Diaz provides positive update after drug abuse allegations

Miller continued.

"A lot of people will glob on you and drag you in this direction, that direction."

"It's super easy to fall into, let aline huge superstar champions like Nick Diaz and BJ Penn."

"So it's hard for me to come off without sounding negative about these guys' experience right now."

"But right now, look, we see that it's not going perfect. And both camps have told me that they're on the right path to get back together."

Nick Diaz looked set to return to the UFC late last year but problems occurred preventing that from happening.

Listen to Jason Miller's comments on Nick Diaz and more below.
UFC.content:encodedSnippet:
Over the past couple of years, fans have been concerned for Nick Diaz's wellbeing outside of the cage. 
The older Diaz brother has had an impressive career in the sport, managing to capture Strikeforce gold and being recognized as one of the biggest names in MMA during his heights. After dealing with suspension and various other issues, the now-41-year-old stumbled upon some problems in his personal life.
Many feared the worst, expecting Nick Diaz to go down an un-salvageable path, but that may not be the case.
Hoping to get back into the octagon, Diaz seems to be on the mend. According to UFC veteran Jason Miller, the fan-favorite is on the right path.
"Somebody [from Nick Diaz's camp] gave me a note," Miller said. "[The note said], 'Hey, look, he's getting it together.'"
Miller later weighed in on Diaz's struggles outside of competing, shedding light on the struggles that similar people face.
"It's very sensitive to talk about this guys journey because I have a lot of empathy for it."
"Because it's easy, like I said, to fall into this darkness. People do not understand how, you know, if you're a C-level celebrity, it's super easy."
Related: Nick Diaz provides positive update after drug abuse allegations
Miller continued.
"A lot of people will glob on you and drag you in this direction, that direction."
"It's super easy to fall into, let aline huge superstar champions like Nick Diaz and BJ Penn."
"So it's hard for me to come off without sounding negative about these guys' experience right now."
"But right now, look, we see that it's not going perfect. And both camps have told me that they're on the right path to get back together."
Nick Diaz looked set to return to the UFC late last year but problems occurred preventing that from happening.
Listen to Jason Miller's comments on Nick Diaz and more below.
UFC.dc:creator: Joshua Ryan
UFC.content: Amid concerns, a UFC veteran has provided an update on Nick Diaz's wellbeing.
UFC.contentSnippet: Amid concerns, a UFC veteran has provided an update on Nick Diaz's wellbeing.

UFC.title: UFC Vegas 104 Weigh-In Results: Two Fighters Miss Weight
UFC.content:encoded:
Former middleweight title challenger Marvin Vettori returns for the first time since June 2023 this weekend against a familiar foe. Vettori headlines the UFC Vegas 104 fight card at the UFC Apex in Las Vegas in a rematch abasing Roman Dolidze.

Vettori defeated the Georgian by decision in their first meeting at UFC 286. They'll run it back on Saturday. Vettori and Dolidze both weighed in at 186 pounds.

Two fighters missed weight on Friday: Chidi Njokuani and Diyar Nurgozhay. Despite the failure to make weight, all fights will proceed as planned. Nurgozhay was fined 25% of his fight purse while Njokuani was fined 20% of his.

UFC.title: Donald Trump voices honest opinion of Conor McGregor
UFC.content:encoded:
Since his inauguration, Donald Trump has been working hard in attempts to make America great again. However, he still manages to talk about his passion for mixed martial arts from time to time—with Conor McGregor's name being the point of discussion during a recent meeting.

From the regular fan up to billionaire entrepreneurs, McGregor has divided opinion; as most elite athletes do. Some believe that his ability in the cage is overshadowed by his shortcomings outside of it, which are beginning to pile up in his absence from the sport.

After Donald Trump announced Khabib Nurmagomedov as his favorite UFC fighter, things soured between the United States president and Conor McGregor.

The rift between the two was short-lived and 'The Notorious' was invited to attend the Starlight Ball alongside several other big-name celebrities.

Fast forward almost two months to Wednesday, March 12, where Donald Trump sat down in the Oval Office with Ireland's prime minister, Michael Martin. The two had much to discuss, with Conor McGregor being one of them.

"I do happen to like your fighter," Trump told Martin during their meeting. "He's got the best tattoo I've ever seen."

"Conor's great, right. You have a lot of great Irish fighters, actually. Great fighters. I don't know what that is but Ireland's always had a lot of good fighters."

"[Do] you know why? Because they're tough people. They're smart people and they're passionate people."

Check out Donald Trump's comments on Conor McGregor below.

.@realDonaldTrump says he's a big fan of Conor McGregor:

"I do happen to like your fighter. He's got the best tattoos I've ever seen. Conor's great... Ireland's always had a lot of good fighters—you know why, because they're tough people." pic.twitter.com/734IEARojZ

— Trump War Room (@TrumpWarRoom) March 12, 2025

Related: Donald Trump's newly appointed FBI Director wants UFC agreement

While they have had some bumps in their relationship, Conor McGregor has long been an admirer of Donald Trump and what he stands for.

McGregor was quick to react to news of Trump's shooting.

Among many other UFC fighters, the Irishman shed praise on the 78-year-old for brushing aside the attempt on his life and instead choosing to stand up for his country, and it seems the respect between the two is mutual.

UFC.title: Dana White provides timeline for Jon Jones vs. Tom Aspinall fight
UFC.content:encoded:
After months of uncertainty, Dana White has provided a positive—and somewhat hopeful—update on the ongoing Jon Jones vs. Tom Aspinall saga.

The heavyweight division has been stuck in limbo since 'Bones' captured the title over two years ago. Since then, the 37-year-old has defended his throne once to Stipe Miocic and is seemingly avoiding any potential matchup with the rightful number-one contender, Tom Aspinall.

Some news has surfaced recently that suggests the blockbuster clash is moving in the right direction, and Dana White's most recent update adds to that.

"Listen, Jon Jones definitely wants to fight," White claimed. "[It's] just when and where is what we're working on now."

According to Tom Aspinall, Jon Jones' side is holding up the deal. The Brit believes the bout should have been finalized by now, though White isn't worried about the status of the matchup.

"I'm very confident that fight happens," White said. "[In the summer], yeah."

Rumors suggest this will be the biggest payday of Jon Jones' career and likely his final walk to the octagon.

A massive $30 million purse is what could be needed to secure the most significant fight in UFC heavyweight history. A collision between a man that looks like an unstoppable force and a champion that is arguably the greatest fighter ever may be too hard to pass up for Dana White.

Related: Dana White shares update on Jon Jones future

Alongside Tom Aspinall, Alex Pereira was also being mentioned as a potential fight for Jon Jones, though Dana White wasn't a huge fan of the idea.

"You're trying to ask a guy to move up two weight classes to heavyweight and take on the greatest of all time... There's still tough guys to fight in the light heavyweight division."

"I believe in moving up after you clean out divisions and this division wasn't cleaned out yet."

The Jon Jones vs. Alex Pereira is no longer an option following Pereira's loss to Magomed Ankalaev last time out.

Check out Dana White's thoughts below.

UFC.title: TKO planning mega event featuring UFC, WWE, and boxing all on one card
UFC.content:encoded:
Since acquiring the UFC, fans have only had a small taste of what's possible under the TKO banner, but that could all be about to change.

TKO Group Holdings managed to merge the sport's entertainment and combat sports after their purchase of Zuffa—the UFC's parent company—in 2023. We've been treated to several crossovers between the two worlds following the purchase, though nothing as big as the rumors in circulation.

According to Billi Bhatti of The Wrestling Informer, TKO is planning a blockbuster event featuring the UFC, WWE, and boxing.

Hoping to finally showcase what they're capable of with their sporting portfolio, an event like no other could be on the way.

As stated by Bhatti, the likely destination for the one-of-a-kind show will be Saudi Arabia—who have shown strong interest in all three of the major combat sport industries.

"At some point this year or next, a mega card is expected to take place in Saudi Arabia," Bhatti said during an episode of The Wrestling Informer podcast. "Featuring boxing, UFC or MMA, and WWE all on the same event."

"This will serve as the ultimate showcase of everything under the TKO banner."

A massive combat sports event is reportedly being planned by TKO 🤯

“At some point this year or next, a mega card is expected to take place in Saudi Arabia. Featuring UFC, boxing, and WWE all on the same event.”

(via Wrestling Informer) pic.twitter.com/Y2RD1lq8Ky

— Happy Punch (@HappyPunch) March 13, 2025

Related: Dana White reveals huge plans for TKO boxing promotion

If the past is any indicator, Dana White will pull out all the stops to steal the spotlight from his competitors.

Though nothing has been confirmed, the UFC have various big name fighters on their roster that could feature if the TKO event comes to fruition.

News of the unique event comes on the back of the founding of TKO Boxing.

The new promotion is hoping to build from the ground up and see the crossover show as a great chance display their talent.

Dana White and Turki Alalshikh are determined to take over the sport of boxing and believe their one-title per weight class system is the future.

UFC.title: Dana White 'dying' for Conor McGregor return
UFC.content:encoded:
With there being no return date in sight, Dana White is reportedly desperate for Conor McGregor to buck his ideas up and make his UFC return.

While the talent pool is undoubtedly the best it has ever been in mixed martial arts, the UFC is arguably at its worst in terms of star power. For potentially the first time in modern history, the company doesn't have one champion capable of selling huge pay-per-views—with their biggest draws being Islam Makhachev and a Jon Jones on the verge of retirement.

Though he shouldn't be your first source of information regarding the UFC, Brendan Schaub made a strong point about the UFC's current state.

"UFC's in some trouble, man," Schaub said during an episode of The Fighter and The Kid podcast. "Name their big star."

"Belal [Muhammad]? I love him [but he's not a star]. [Magomed] Ankalaev? How many pay-per-views is he selling? Two. His mum and his uncle."

"[Alexandre] Pantoja, 135. We don't give a f***. 125, who else you got? Merab [Dvalishvili]? Nah, not happening... We're talking about pay-per-view stars, bud. Big difference. Nobody."

"At middleweight, [Dricus Du Plessis] has a chance, he's probably the most exciting. [Islam] Makhachev. Makhachev is probably their biggest star."

"[Alex] Pereira is still their most pay-per-view guy but Makhachev's their biggest star. Pound-for-pound and, you know, he's exciting."

Related: Nate Diaz lashes out at 'Ewok' Islam Makhachev

Turning his attention to fighters of Russian descent, Schaub insisted that outside of Islam Makhachev, they're not exciting fighters.

"Who's their most exciting fighter? Islam. Outside of Islam, who? Ankalaev?... I like Merab, he's not a finisher, though. You're not selling pay-per-views off that."

Conor McGregor is featured in the main event of 8 of the UFC's 10 most bought pay-per-views in history. 

McGregor's popularity helped Khabib Nurmagomedov, Nate Diaz, and others gain more credibility from the casual fan, but now there isn't anybody remotely close to his level of fame.

Brendan Schaub's co-host on his podcast, Bryan Callen, later weighed in on the discussion.

"They're dying for a Conor [McGregor], Callen said. "Also, [the Russian fighters] are not talkers. They're not talkers, they just get their job done. They're soldiers..."

"We want the bad boys, we want the Irish, we want the Ian Machado Gary's."

Check it out below.

UFC.title: Dana White confirms Kash Patel ‘dead serious’ about UFC fighters training FBI agents
UFC.content:encoded:
Kash Patel allegedly wants FBI agents to be trained by UFC fighters and Dana White has now confirmed that Patel is ‘dead serious’ about making it happen.

Patel believes the United States law enforcement can be boosted in several areas. The 45-year-old will now put his plans into motion after becoming the ninth director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation—with mixed martial arts set to play a huge role.

Several UFC fighters have expressed an interest in helping serve their country by training FBI agents. 

For the first time since Kash Patel's comments became public, Dana White has shared his opinion on the idea.

"Well, after [Patel] said that, my phone blew up," White said in response to the rumored FBI and UFC partnership. "Everybody wants to be the trainers to the FBI now."

White later confirmed that the rumors were true and Patel was determined to make it happen.

"But he's dead serious about that. I talked to him about it tonight. Yeah, he's dead serious."

"So, we'll see. We'll see how that starts to come together."

Alongside many athletes on the UFC roster, Dana White seems fond of the plan to integrate a different level of combat sports into the law enforcement agency.

The UFC is home to countless men and women who are proud to represent the United States of America by any means necessary. 

Related: Justin Gaethje willing to train FBI agents

One man who has thrown his name into the hat to help train FBI agents going forward is former interim lightweight champion Justin Gaethje.

The fan-favorite spoke of his interest in helping the officers during the build-up to UFC 311. On Saturday, the proud American earned a much-needed victory over Rafael Fiziev—beating the Azerbaijani for the second time and moving closer to a shot at the lightweight title.

Having a top-level professional breaking bread with the FBI's elite will undoubtedly be a boost to the security service—which is why Kash Patel remains serious about the idea.

Listen to what Dana White had to say about the FBI, Kash Patel's unique proposal, and more below.

UFC.title: Canelo Alvarez punches interviewer three times during unusual quiz
UFC.content:encoded:
As he has displayed all 66 times he has stepped into the ring, Canelo Alvarez packs an incredible punch—and one interviewer got to find that out the hard way.

The Mexican star is a menace between the ropes, securing 39 knockouts of the 62 wins throughout his boxing career. While his most recent knockout win occurred three years ago, the 34-year-old has heavy hands and will likely be searching for a finish in the first outing of his four-fight deal with Turki Alalshikh on May 3.

In the build-up to his return to the squared circle, Canelo Alvarez partook in an incredibly unique interview. The rules were simple: Punch the interviewer if Alvarez heard a better boxer than himself.

The interviewer listed several of Alvarez's past opponents, including Caleb Plant, Edgar Berlanga, and Gennady Golovkin, who were just some of the names presented to the boxing legend. 

The first punch came when Dmitry Bivol was mentioned, with Alvarez insisting, 'On that night, he was better than me.' 

After controversially bypassing Oleksandr Usyk, the Guadalajara native found a home for the second punch when Floyd Mayweather's name surfaced.

Canelo Alvarez and Floyd Mayweather shared the ring over a decade ago, with Mayweather coming out on top with the majority decision. 

The third and final punch came when the late great Muhammad Ali was mentioned.

Similar to Mike Tyson, Ali was considered a global treasure and a man who far surpassed the fame of the ring. His stature in the game will forever be on display for future generations, which is why the majority of boxing fans and boxers alike shed praise on him whenever possible.

In search of that type of greatness, Canelo Alvarez makes his return to the ring when he meets the undefeated William Scull in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia on May 3.

UFC.title: Aljamain Sterling explains why Alexander Volkanovski will 'put the beats on Diego Lopes'
UFC.content:encoded:
The vacant featherweight title will be up for grabs in the UFC 314 main event April 12 in Miami, Florida. Former champion Alexander Volkanovski faces No. 3 ranked Diego Lopes at Kaseya Center for the title Ilia Topuria relinquished to move up to the lightweight division.  

Former bantamweight champion and current ninth-ranked featherweight contender Aljamain Sterling gave his prediction for the upcoming title bout and believes it will be one-sided. 

"I think Volkanovski's going to put the beats on Lopes," Sterling said on his YouTube channel. "I truly do think Volk is going to put the beats on him, and I'm going to give them the reason why Volk is going to whoop that ass."

"Volkanovski is coming with a vengeance. He is in phenomenal shape. What he does great versus what Diego Lopes does great is not the same. Volk is super well-rounded. He's strong in every single department. Maybe not a submission specialist but he's very hip to the grappling game," continued Sterling. "Diego Lopes is a very good grappler in terms of submission threats but when it comes to striking his an all or nothing guy in the first round. There's no pacing about Diego Lopes."

"He's an all or nothing, blitz type of fighter. He runs at you, sprints at you in the first minute or two and if he clips you, he smells blood in the water, he's very, very good at finishing fights from there. If that is his game plan against Volkanovski, and he has no plan B, Diego Lopes is going to lose this fight. There's no other way to say it. He's not going five rounds toe-to-toe with Alex Volkanovski. It's just not happening."

UFC.title: Israel Adesanya: 'I had Alex Pereira winning'
UFC.content:encoded:
Magomed Ankalaev ended Alex Pereira's light heavyweight title reign on Saturday, defeating the Brazilian champion in the UFC 313 main event by unanimous decision. But not everyone agreed with the judges' scorecards.

The debate rages on in comment sections and in social media replies. There's no shortage of YouTube videos weighing in on who they thought won the fight.

Former two-time middleweight champion Israel Adesanya was one of those that scored the fight for "Poatan". In a UFC 313 reaction video posted to his YouTube channel, Adesanya showed his immediate response to the decision.

After two rounds, Adesanya had the fight scored one round each. The third round he scored for Pereira. 

"I think it's 'And still,' Adesanya said before the official scorecards were read. "What a stupid game we play," he said after the scorecards were announced. 

"49-46, what was that? He dropped him. Yeah, won that round too. The holding. He didn't really do much with the holding. What a stupid game we play. I f*cking love it. Stupid f*cking game," Adesanya said.

“I had Alex winning,” Adesanya continued. “I’d have to watch it again and score the fight properly. The round two might have played a factor just because he dropped him but then holding against the fence I don’t really remember him getting any takedowns."

UFC 313 took place at T-Mobile Arena in Las Vegas. The light heavyweight title fight headlined the event.

UFC.title: Canelo Alvarez welcomes Jake Paul fight under one condition
UFC.content:encoded:
Canelo Alvarez has finally expressed an interest in a Jake Paul fight but only under one condition.

The boxing legend holds all the cards in any potential matchup against the social media star. At 34 years old, the Mexican is still one of the best fighters in the world and he believes that more work must be done in the ring before he is willing to entertain a fight against the controversial figure.

Despite years of declining interest, Canelo Alvarez looked destined to face Jake Paul after reports stated the pair had agreed to fight. That bout eventually fell through and Alvarez has now shared further information on the canceled affair.

"I think everybody wants to see me beat Jake Paul," Alvarez said. "I thought about it for a minute, we agreed for the promoters to go and see what the numbers are for that fight in May."

"I don't call that a fight, I call it an event. That event needs to wait. It's not the moment to do that kind of event at this moment in my career."

"I think at the end of my career, when I'm retired, maybe. We'll see."

Alvarez later praised Paul for being dedicated to the craft, though he admits it's difficult to rate the YouTuber's ability.

"He's focused. He's focused on boxing. He's disciplined. We need to credit him for that. Maybe he's more disciplined than other fighters."

"But, as a fighter, it's very difficult to say. That's why when you say 'a fight with Jake Paul' for me, it's difficult to say a fight. It's more an event than a fight."

Related: Canelo Alvarez's monster contract with Turki Alalshikh details leaked

Any potential fight between the two will have to wait as Canelo Alvarez nears his return to the ring.

On May 3, Alvarez will welcome William Scull into the ring to kickstart his four-fight deal with Turki Alalshikh.

UFC.title: Conor McGregor returns to beat opponents to a pulp on soccer field
UFC.content:encoded:
Conor McGregor is taking a liking to soccer and has just competed in an instant classic for his renowned Irish bar's team, Black Forge FC.

The Irishman sparked a viral moment last time out when he battered and bruised his opponents on the way to a 1-0 victory. While news on his future inside the octagon remains bleak, it seems 'The Notorious' has found a new hobby after returning to the soccer field this past weekend.

Conor McGregor managed to convert his aggressive style inside the cage onto the soccer pitch, to some backlash. McGregor has shown that he isn't afraid to dive into a challenge and could have caused serious damage with some of the reckless tackles he was committing.

That hasn't stopped him from returning to the field alongside his Black Forge FC teammates to punish the opposing team once again.

Despite falling to a 2-goal deficit and being handed two red cards, Conor McGregor's team sensationally rallied back to complete an instant-classic affair. A gutsy performance saw a nine-man BFFC come away with a 3-2 victory and the celebrations got underway.

Related: Conor McGregor batters and bruises opponents in soccer match

Following the win, McGregor invited the entire team back to the Black Forge Inn, offering them free drinks for the entire night.

"What a f***ing game!" McGregor said after his team's win. "Black Forge FC come from behind 2-0 to win 3-2, while 2 men down!"

"OMG the gaf is hopping tonight. Free bar for the whole squad. All day, all night."

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Conor McGregor Official (@thenotoriousmma)

Whether it's Conor McGregor's ability with the ball at his feet or just his presence on the pitch, to come back from two goals down while down to nine-men is an incredible feat.

McGregor continues to flourish on the soccer field but all eyes are firmly placed on his questionable return to the UFC.

UFC.title: Tom Aspinall reacts to Magomed Ankalaev defeating Alex Pereira, calls for rematch
UFC.content:encoded:
All eyes were on Saturday's UFC 313 main event to see the light heavyweight champion Alex Pereira take on the top contender in the division Magomed Ankalaev. 

The fight went the distance and the judges scored Ankalaev the winner via unanimous decision. Pereira's dominance over the 205-division ended and a new champion was crowned. 

Along with the millions of fight fans watching worldwide, interim heavyweight titleholder Tom Aspinall tuned in and provided his realtime reaction to the light heavy heavyweight title changing hands.  

"Dana White not looking too happy there if I say so myself. Uncle Dana doesn't look too happy. Alex Pereira certainly doesn't look too happy," Aspinall said on his YouTube channel after the scorecards were read. 

"First of all, great fight. Anyone that says it wasn't doesn't know MMA. I thought it was an amazing fight," Aspinall said. "The key to winning for Ankalaev, in my opinion, he wanted it more, pressure; he looked the fresher man, mixing in the takedowns and the striking beautifully. I wasn't sure if he'd do that, to be honest."

Related: UFC 313 Alex Pereira vs. Magomed Ankalaev Official Scorecard

During the UFC 313 Post-Fight Press Conference, UFC CEO Dana White said that Pereira and Ankalaev are likely headed for an immediate rematch and Aspinall agrees if that's the path the fight promotion takes. 

"Alex Pereira's reign is done for now. In my opinion, immediate rematch. It should be their next (fight)," Aspinall said. "Alex Pereira is a massive, massive, massive star in the sport of MMA. Massive. Lost his title, but the run that he's been on has warranted an immediate rematch, in my opinion."

UFC.title: Justin Gaethje: 'I'm the most exciting guy that's ever stepped in there'
UFC.content:encoded:
The UFC 313 co-main event rematch between No. 3 ranked lightweight Justin Gaethje and No. 11 ranked Rafael Fiziev earned 'Fight of the Night' honors and largely lived up to the hype. 

Gaethje was originally scheduled to faced Dan Hooker but a hand injury forced Hooker out of the fight. His injury led to the booking of the rematch. Gaethje and Fiziev previously fought at UFC 286 in 2023 with Gaethje winning via majority decision.

 On Saturday, at T-Mobile Arena in Las Vegas, Gaethje set the pace and took the fight to the late replacement. In the second round, an uppercut landed cleanly sending Fiziev crashing to the canvas. He recovered and fought on.

"I mean, 12-days notice. For him to not get completely exhausted. He deserves so much credit," Gaethje said about Fiziev after the fight. "That's one tough son of a b*tch."

Who does Justin Gaethje want to fight next?

Gaethje wants to fight for the title again. If the former interim titleholder had his way, he'd be fighting for the world championship in his next fight. 

During his UFC 313 post-fight interview with Joe Rogan, Gaethje said that he doesn't have a choice in who her faces next. 

"I'm No. 3 in the world. I'm the most exciting guy that's ever stepped in there, and I don't have a choice. It's all on the UFC. We'll see what they want," he said.

UFC.title: Colby Covington hits out at 'scumbag' LeBron James
UFC.content:encoded:
Since adopting his WWE-like persona, Colby Covington hasn't made a lot of friends in and around the sporting world.

Throughout the controversial happenings in Hollywood, 'Chaos' called out LeBron James for his connection to a number of people in that space. After several rants, the animosity by the UFC ace to the NBA star seemingly died down, until now.

After being involved in an altercation with Stephen A. Smith, LeBron James confronted the sport's television personality for comments he made about his son, Bronny James.

The video of James and Smith's confrontation went viral and Colby Covington has since weighed in on the situation.

"What a scumbag, bro," Covington said. "Like, dude, it's America. Freedom of speech f***ing LeBron."

"Do you not realize we have constitutional amendments for a reason. Oh yeah, you don't care about that."

"You're bought and sold by the Chinese f***ing finger puppets."

Colby Covington continued, almost wishing death on the Los Angeles Lakers standout.

"You're a scumbag LeBron. You don't care about this country that made you all that money."

"I hope you f***ing get sick and f***ing, and worse. I don't even want to say any worse but you're a terrible human being."

Related: Colby Covington may move to middleweight

"You put targets on the back of our law enforcement, our f***ing first responders—who you use privately for your family to secure you."

"You're just not a good person. You're despicable and I despise you."

Covington ended by calling out James.

"F*** LeBron James, you b**** ass motherf***er."

"Come see a real motherf***ing OG and get your ass knocked the f*** out without your private security."

LeBron James has divided opinion on the court for a long time but there's arguably no bigger hater of the star than Colby Covington.

Listen to Covington lash out at 'King' James in the video below.

UFC.title: UFC 313 Alex Pereira vs. Magomed Ankalaev Official Scorecard
UFC.content:encoded:
The Ultimate Fighting Championship crowned a new light heavyweight champion on Saturday. 

Magomed Ankalaev defeated Alex Pereira in the UFC 313 main event at T-Mobile Arena in Las Vegas ending the Brazilian's title reign. It was a competitive fight with Pereira delivering leg kicks and Ankalaev pressuring and connecting with his right hands. 

Pereira's improved takedown defense was on display but he wasn't able to escape the clinch at times and seemed hesitant to pull the trigger at distance. Ankalaev was able to back Pereira up throughout the fight forcing "Poatan" to fight backing up. 

All three judges scored the fight for Ankalaev. See how they scored each round.

UFC.title: Magomed Ankalaev dethrones Alex Pereira in UFC 313 main event
UFC.content:encoded:
The light heavyweight title was on the line in the UFC 313 main event on Saturday at T-Mobile Arena in Las Vegas. Champion Alex Pereira faced the top 205-pound contender Magomed Ankalaev after weeks of back and forth banter. 

Pereira won the championship at UFC 295 in November 2023 by knocking out Jiri Prochazka for the vacant title. He defended the belt three times, finishing each challenger.

Ankalaev hadn't lost a fight since 2018. He fought Jan Blachowicz for the vacant title at UFC 282. The bout ended in a split draw. After picking up back-to-back wins since the title fight, Ankalaev got a second chance at UFC gold on Saturday.

Pereira took the center of the octagon and inched forward. He landed a calf kick followed by another. Pereira continued to target Ankalaev's lead leg. Ankalaev delivered a leg kick in response. They stood in front of each other and Ankalaev began landing leg kicks. They exchanged leg kicks. Ankalaev started pressuring Pereira late in the round. Pereira landed another calf kick and Ankalaev worked to get a takedown in the closing seconds. MMAWeekly scored the round 10-9 for Pereira. 

Ankalaev came out pressuring Pereira in the second round. After taking another leg kick, Ankalaev switched stances. He delivered a front kick to the body. Ankalaev's leg kicks left a red mark on Pereira's lead leg. He stopped in with a right hand. Pereira responded with a leg kick. Pereira went high with a kick. Ankalaev responds with a right hand. Ankalaev landed a counter left hook. Pereira went back to delivering calf kicks. Pereira began pressuring Ankalaev. They exchanged right hands. Ankalaev connected with a left. A left hand by Ankalaev staggered Pereira at the end of the round. MMAWeekly scored the round 10-9 for Ankalaev.

Ankalaev went to the body followed by back to back leg kicks to start the third frame. Pereira continued to invest in calf kicks. Pereira went to the body with a kick and Ankalaev reacted with a front kick to the body. A coupe of leg kicks had Ankalaev to briefly look for a takedown. Pereira shook off the attempt and went back to landing leg kicks. Ankalaev clinched but Pereira quickly circled free. Ankalaev kept the pressure on Pereira while Pereira continued to target his legs. MMAWeekly scored the round 10-9 for Ankalaev.

Ankalaev quickly crossed the cage and clinched. He delivered knees to the legs of Pereira against the fence. Pereira's takedown defense held up and he circled free. Ankalaev immediately clinched again. They exchanged knees to the body along the cage. Ankalaev was able to control Pereira in the clinch but wasn't able to get him down. The referee separated them with two minutes on the clock. Ankalaev partially landed a right hand. He closed the distance and tied Pereira up against the cage. Ankalaev delivered knees to the body and Pereira was unable to get free from the clinch. MMAWeekly scored the round 10-9 for Ankalaev. As time ran out on the round, Pereira tossed Ankalaev to the ground. 

Daniel Cormier thought the fight was two rounds each heading into the final frame. 

Ankalaev landed front kicks to the body. He stepped in with a hard right hand. Pereira a left and Ankalaev reacted with a right hand to the body. Pereira seemed hesitant to pull the trigger. He landed a jab followed by a head kick. Ankalaev answered with a jab. Ankalaev backed Pereira up with pressure. Pereira landed a leg kick followed by a jab that snapped Ankalaev's head back. Ankalaev quickly clinched. Pereira was unable to get free from the clinch in the closing moments but Ankalaev didn't inflict any damage from the position. MMAWeekly scored the round 10-9 for Pereira but a couple of rounds could have gone either way. 

The judges scored the fight for Ankalaev by unanimous decision. The scorecards read 49-46, 48-47, and 48-47. And new!

UFC.title: Justin Gaethje puts on striking display in decision win over Rafael Fiziev
UFC.content:encoded:
Lightweight contender Justin Gaethje was originally scheduled to faced Dan Hooker in the UFC 313 co-main event but a hand injury forced Hooker out of the fight. His injury led to the booking of an exciting rematch.

No. 11 ranked Rafael Fiziev stepped in to replace Hooker against the No. 3 ranked Gaethje. The two previously fought at UFC 286 with Gaethje winning via majority decision. The bout earned 'Fight of the Night' honors. On Saturday, they ran it back at T-Mobile Arena in Las Vegas.  

The two touched gloved and picked up where they left off in March 2023 in their first meeting. Gaethje took the center of the cage and delivered a leg kick to start the fight. Gaethje pressured Fiziev early and Fiziev took Gaethje down. Gaethje got to his feet but was taken down again. In the scramble, Fiziev applied a reverse triangle. Gaethje freed himself and exploded back to his feet. Gaethje stepped into the pocket and connected with an uppercut. Fiziev responded with a leg kick. They two clinched and Fiziev landed to knees to the body. Once separated, Fiziev continued to target Gaethje's body with kicks. Gaethje tied him up before separating. Gaethje connected with a hard right hand. Gaethje looked to get the fight to the ground and landed a right hand in the closing seconds. MMAWeekly scored the round 10-9 for Fiziev.

Gaethje pressured Fiziev to start the second frame. Gaethje landed a right hand on the inside. Fiziev accidentally landed a low kick. The fight was restarted within seconds. Once restarted, Fiziev connected with a right hand. Gaethje landed a right hand. He's backed Fiziev with his pressure. Gaethje connected with a combination on the inside. Fiziev went back to targeting Gaethje's body.  Fiziev landed a hard right hand.  Gaethje responded with a right of his own. They briefly clinched and Gaethje landed a right hand on the break. Fiziev stepped in with a knee. Gaethje stepped forward with an uppercut that dropped Fiziev. Gaethje followed him to the canvas looking to finish. Fiziev rolled to his. knees. He stood with 20 seconds on the clock but was able to stay out of danger. MMAWeekly scored the round 10-9 for Gaethje. 

Gaethje inched forward to start the final round. He landed a short uppercut. Fiziev responded with a stiff jab. Gaethje connected with another uppercut. Fiziev delivered a left hook followed by a kick to the body. Fiziev delivered two kicks to the body. Gaethje landed a head kick. Fiziev ate it. Gaethje began landing more often. Fiziev looked to have slowed. Gaethje landed another uppercut and looked to get the fight to the ground in the final minute. They separated and Gaethje landed a head kick and fired off punches until the end. MMAWeekly scored the round 10-9 for Gaethje. 

The judges scored the fight for Gaethje by unanimous decision. All three scorecards read 29-28.

UFC.title: Mauricio Ruffy kicks off UFC 313 main card with insane KO of King Green | Video
UFC.content:encoded:
Lightweight Maurício Ruffy kicked off the UFC 313 main card at T-Mobile Arena on Saturday with a Knockout of the Year candidate.  

King Green, known for keeping his hands low, paid the price early in the opening round against the precision striker.

In the early moments, Ruffy connected with a straight right hand that briefly staggered Green. Green remained in front of Ruffy and tried to keep him at distance with punches.  

Ruffy remained patient and uncorked a spinning wheel kick that connected cleanly. Green went limp and fell face-first on the canvas. 

One of the greatest KOs in UFC history. Simply amazing. 🤓 pic.twitter.com/uVGKzPISCq

— Ariel Helwani (@arielhelwani) March 9, 2025

"That's one of the best knockouts I've ever seen," said former two-division champion and commentator Daniel Cormier. 

With the win, Ruffy extended his win streak to seven consecutive fights. He also put the 155-pound division on notice.

UFC.title: Two UFC 313 bouts canceled hours before event
UFC.content:encoded:
The UFC 313 fight card lost two fights just hours before the event was set to begin at T-Mobile Arena in Las Vegas. 

The heavyweight bout that was scheduled as the featured prelim match between contender Curtis Blaydes and Rizvan Kuniev and the featherweight bout between John Castaneda and Chris Gutierrez have been canceled due to illness. 

The fight promotion announced that Blaydes and Castaneda fell victim to illness resulting in the two bouts being scrapped from the fight card. It's unclear whether they matchups will be rebooked for a future event.

UFC 313 will proceed with a 10-bout fight card and some adjusting of the bout order.  With the changes, there will be only one early preliminary card bout. Check out the new lineup below.

Related: UFC 313: Pereira vs. Ankalaev Live Results

MAIN CARD 

  • Alex Pereira vs. Magomed Ankalaev
  • Rafael Fiziev vs. Justin Gaethje
  • Ignacio Bahamondes vs. Jalin Turner
  • Amanda Lemos vs. Iasmin Lucindo
  • King Green vs. Mauricio Ruffy

PRELIMINARY CARD

  • Rei Tsuruya vs. Joshua Van
  • Brunno Ferreira vs. Armen Petrosyan
  • Carlos Leal vs. Alex Morono
  • Francis Marshall vs. Mairon Santos

PRELIMINARY CARD

  • Ozzy Diaz vs. Djorden Santos

In the co-main event, lightweight contenders Justin Gaethje and Rafael Fiziev rematch. The two first fought at UFC 286 in March 2023. The bout earned 'Fight of the Night' honors and ended Gaethje narrowly winning via majority decision.

EARLY PRELIMINARY CARD (ESPN+, 6:30 p.m. ET)

  • Ozzy Diaz def. Djorden Santos via unanimous decision (29–28, 29–28, 29–28)

UFC.title: Dana White shares update on Jon Jones future
UFC.content:encoded:
Jon Jones has almost been out of sight out of mind for several months but Dana White has provided an update on his future in the sport.

'Bones' has already cemented himself as one of the greatest to ever compete in any form of combat sports but his legacy is in question. The 37-year-old has come under fire from fans for allegedly ducking a fight against the reigning interim heavyweight champion Tom Aspinall.

While all has gone quiet on his future, Dana White has now provided a positive update on Jon Jones' return to the octagon.

Despite the doubts, White isn't phased by any rumors suggesting Jones may be looking for a way out of his rumored Aspinall clash.

The UFC CEO recently discussed the Hall-of-Famer's imminent future in the sport.

"Jones will fight anybody," White said as fight rumors begin to heat up. "Don't let the internet fool you about Jon Jones."

If White's words are true, fans should stop fretting about the ongoing negotiations between Jon Jones and Tom Aspinall.

The pair have been rumored to meet inside the cage for almost two years. Since then, the Brit has gone on to successfully defend his interim strap while Jones managed to earn a dominant title defense against Stipe Miocic.

Related: Tom Aspinall: Jon Jones 'holding up' UFC heavyweight title unification bout

Despite contradicting reports, the pair seem to be on a collision course for what would likely be the biggest fight in UFC heavyweight history.

As several contenders begin to emerge in the division, many fans are hoping to get some clarification on the title picture in the near future.

One man who is impatiently waiting for news is Tom Aspinall. Should Dana White's comments ring true, the heavyweight affair will likely take place later this year.

Listen to what White had to say about Jon Jones vs. Tom Aspinall below.

UFC.title: UFC 313 weigh-in results and video: All fighters on point
UFC.content:encoded:
The fighters competing on Saturday's UFC 313: Pereira vs. Ankalaev fight card will officially weigh-in on Friday in Las Vegas. 

The event takes place at T-Mobile Arena and is headlined by a light heavyweight title bout between champion Alex Pereira and top contender Magomed Ankalaev.

Pereira (12-2) won the 205-pound championship at UFC 295 in November 2023 by knocking out Jiri Prochazka for the vacant title. He's defended the belt three times, finishing each challenger.

Ankalaev (19-1-1, 1 NC) hasn't lost a fight since 2018. He fought Jan Blachowicz for the vacant title at UFC 282 and the bout ended in a split draw. After picking up back-to-back wins since the title fight, Ankalaev will compete for the championship again. 

Ankalaev was the first fighter to weigh in and tipped the scale at 205 pounds. Pereira came in at the same weight, 205 pounds.

UFC.title: Conor McGregor invites Sabrina Carpenter to 'proper Irish dining experience'
UFC.content:encoded:
Sabrina Carpenter has emerged as one of the biggest pop stars in the world and is even getting the attention of UFC ace Conor McGregor.

The musician best known for her hit song 'Espresso' has shot into the limelight and quickly became a global celebrity over recent years. Her fame has offered her the chance to tour the world performing her music and has garnered the attention of some familiar faces.

Ahead of Sabrina Carpenter's second performance in Dublin, Ireland, Conor McGregor reached out to the 25-year-old.

Attempting to entice Carpenter to make an appearance at his bar, McGregor shared a post on social media.

"Sabrina our sweetheart," McGregor wrote on Instagram. "We are in The Black Forge Inn this evening if you and your team wish for a nice meal and drinks after your big show."

McGregor often relishes the chance to invite celebrities to the Black Forge Inn when given the chance.

'The Notorious' is passionate about his business and believes the experience is proper compared to other similar restaurants and bars.

"Proper Irish dining experience, I would love to look after [you]. We will look after you all! Hope you're enjoying Ireland."

Conor McGregor personally invites Sabrina Carpenter to The Black Forge Inn 🍻 🖤#sabrinacapenter #UFC313 pic.twitter.com/rWkgCT00RP

— Sportskeeda MMA (@sportskeedaMMA) March 6, 2025

Related: Conor McGregor goes crazy at the gun range | VIDEO

Despite having a good time in Ireland, Sabrina Carpenter still found time to hit out at her ex-boyfriend Barry Keoghan.

The beloved actor dated the singer songwriter for some time before eventually splitting up, prompting Carpenter to speak out against him during her performance at the 3Arena.

"Dublin, it's so lovely to be here," Carpenter said. "You all look and sound amazing."

"But my goodness, these Irish boys are hard work."

Two things remain unclear: Did Sabrina Carpenter accept the offer to attend The Black Forge Inn and will Conor McGregor ever compete in the UFC again?

Reports of McGregor's return are beginning to heat up once again, with rumors of a possible Ilia Topuria clash surfacing.

UFC.title: Katie Taylor vs. Amanda Serrano 3 to headline all-women's fight card in July
UFC.content:encoded:
Most Valuable Promotions (MVP) and Netflix today announced that a trilogy bout between undisputed super lightweight champion Katie Taylor and unified featherweight world champion Amanda “The Real Deal” Serrano will headline an all-women's fight card at Madison Square Garden. The event takes place July 11 and will stream on Netflix.

“I want to thank everyone at Matchroom, MVP and Netflix for getting the trilogy over the line and I can't wait to headline at MSG again in July,” said Katie Taylor in a statement. “I’m 2 and 0 against Amanda but it's obviously a very special rivalry that delivers every time we step in the ring so I think it's only right that we have the trilogy. The atmosphere for the first fight there was amazing and I'm sure it won't be any different this time around. The numbers that got to see the last fight in November were incredible so hopefully those people will all want to tune in for the trilogy fight as well and we can deliver another great fight.”

The two first fought in 2022 in a historic first women’s bout to headline a fight card at Madison Square Garden. Taylor defeated Serrano via split decision. A rematch was booked for the co-main event of the Mike Tyson vs. Jake Paul fight card last November. Taylor won by unanimous decision.

“I promised my fans they would see this trilogy, and I’m incredibly grateful that we get to complete our journey where it all began — at Madison Square Garden, live on Netflix for the world to see,” said Amanda Serrano. “I’m disappointed that Katie Taylor did not keep her word and make the trilogy 12 three-minute rounds, equal to the men. This is a record-setting payday for both of us, and we owed it to the fans to honor the handshake deal we made. She didn’t. But make no mistake, every time we share the ring, it is war, and I know Friday, July 11, will be the greatest yet because I will finally get the official W I deserve. Headlining an all-female card at MSG, representing both New York and Puerto Rico, is something I never thought would be possible, and it wouldn’t be without Nakisa Bidarian, Jake Paul, and MVP’s commitment to elevating women’s boxing. I’m proud to stand alongside all the talented women on this card, and I hope our fight inspires young girls everywhere to keep believing in themselves and never stop chasing their dreams.”

Related: Alex Pereira confident Oleksandr Usyk fight happens with new TKO boxing promotion

“This is more than just a fight — it’s a celebration of the unmatched talent of women in boxing,” said Jake Paul and Nakisa Bidarian, co-founders of Most Valuable Promotions. “Amanda Serrano and Katie Taylor have already shattered barriers and inspired millions, and this trilogy fight at the iconic Madison Square Garden will be another historic step forward for women’s sports. This all-women’s card is not only a testament to how far the sport has come but also the beginning of an even greater push from MVP to elevate the next generation of female fighters. Unlike other incumbents in boxing, we have, are, and will always champion women as equals to men, treating them with supreme respect and we will never compromise on those values. Thank you to Netflix and MSG. We’re honored to bring this groundbreaking event to life and remain steadfast in our mission to build and invest in lasting opportunities for women in boxing. This event is the definition of W.”

"Madison Square Garden has been home to the biggest boxing matches in history – including the ‘Fight of the Century,’ and the 2022 bout between Katie Taylor and Amanda Serrano,” said Joel Fisher, Executive Vice President, Marquee Events and Operations, MSG Entertainment. “We are proud to welcome these extraordinary athletes back to The World’s Most Famous Arena for another historic moment with our first-ever all-female professional boxing card.”

UFC.title: Alexander Volkanovski gives his UFC 313 main event prediction
UFC.content:encoded:
With UFC 313 drawing closer, fighters and analysts are weighing in and providing their predictions for the light heavyweight championship main event. Light heavyweight champion Alex Pereira puts his title on the line against top contender Magomed Ankalaev in the headlining bout.

Former featherweight champion Alex Volkanovski gave his breakdown of the matchup and revealed his prediction on his YouTube channel.

"Originally, when I heard about this fight I was like, this is is a tough matchup for Pereira. I still think it is a tough matchup," Volkanovksi said. "But then the more and more I look into it and chat about it, Pereira, his takedown defense is getting better and better."

"Let's remember his fight with Jan Blachowicz. (He) was able to stop takedowns, get back to his feet. Showed a lot of improvements in his takedown defense against a solid wrestler. Probably not as good as Ankalaev. I think Ankalaev's wrestling and grappling is going to be much better than Jan Blachowicz to be quite honest. But I think Pereira's confidence understanding - He's always had a good understanding, but now an even better understanding of the grappling, takedown defense. All that sort of stuff," continued Volkanovski. 

"The Great" believes Pereira will be able to handle Ankalaev's grappling and avoid being submitted if the fight goes to the ground. 

"On the feet, Ankalaev, great fighter. Southpaw. Does some great things. Can look very effective on his feet, but Pereira is insanely good on the feet," Volkanovski said. 

"I think it's going to be hard to bet against Alex Pereira with just how things are going to be. That inside leg kick. I don't know if you remember with Jan Blachowicz and Ankalaev, was able to make a mess of Ankalaev's lead leg. So obviously for him (Pereira) to find that opportunity, it's going to be there."

Volkanovski ultimately picked the champion to retain the title via knockout citing his accuracy and countering ability. 

"I am going to go with the favorite on this one, Alex Pereira. KO. I'm going to go with KO or TKO. I think with him, it's always a pretty safe bet," he said. "I'm thinking maybe second or third round KO."

UFC.title: UFC 313 Embedded, Episode 3: 'We just want to take what's ours'
UFC.content:encoded:
On the third episode of UFC 313 Embedded, Justin Gaethje trains at the UFC PI; Magomed Ankalaev has a striking session; champion Alex Pereira tests his recovery with his physiotherapist; Maurico Ruffy races cars; Gaethje hits golf balls with Megan Olivi; =Rafael Fiziev runs into Chael Sonnen.

UFC 313 takes place Saturday at T-Mobile Arena in Las Vegas. The event is headlined by a light heavyweight title bout between champion Pereira and top contender Ankalaev.

F1.title: Three stripes and you're in – how Mercedes and adidas finally landed F1 collaboration
F1.content:
Mercedes has been keen to work with adidas for some time and finally a 15-year flirtation has resulted in the German brands uniting ahead of the 2025 Formula 1 season.
Alongside the eye-catching fan apparel and the familiar three stripes adorning team gear, there is ongoing technical development that adidas hopes will enable Mercedes to improve its productivity.

F1.title: Why is it so difficult for F1 drivers to race in the wet?
F1.content:
Every generation of racing driver has its supreme talent. Seldom is the difference between this individual and their peers more manifest than when conditions are wet or changeable, goes the established wisdom.
While it’s difficult to argue against most of the names on Autosport’s spreadsheet of victories in grands prix significantly affected by rain, the reality is somewhat more nuanced ...Keep reading

F1.content:

As part of a clampdown on teams exploiting aerodynamic elasticity to an undesirable degree, the FIA told teams over the off-season that it would impose stricter loads tests for both the front and rear wings.

F1.title: F1 2026's 11 teams sign up to new Concorde Agreement
F1.content:
Formula 1 has announced its 11 2026 teams have all signed up to the commercial framework of the new Concorde Agreement.
The Concorde Agreement is a contract between F1, its governing body the FIA and the teams who compete in the series. It defines how F1 is run – with one agreement relating to the regulatory framework of grand prix racing, and another outlining the commercial terms.

F1.title: Obituary: Former F1 team boss Colin Crabbe, the man who gave Ronnie Peterson his chance
F1.content: As the head of his small Formula 1 team, Colin Crabbe, who has died aged 82, was the man who gave Ronnie Peterson his big break.  It was just before Crabbe’s 27th birthday when his Antique Automobiles team made its F1 debut in 1969, in the non-championship Madrid Grand Prix at the brand-new Jarama circuit, with a Maserati-powered Cooper T86B. F1.title: Horner defends "too slow" Lawson after tough Australian GP practice
F1.content:
Liam Lawson’s maiden grand prix weekend with Red Bull got off to a shaky start as he closed out Friday’s second practice session 17th fastest and over half a second slower than team-mate Max Verstappen on the same soft tyre compound.
“Comfortable, just too slow,” said Lawson to Sky Sports F1. “We obviously have a lot of work to do overnight.”
